text: I had previously owned a ReDragon keyboard and mouse combo, but it was wired and didn't have the number pad either. So while building my new computer, I decided to purchase a wireless keyboard/mouse combo. I ordered from a name I never heard of before. Big mistake. The keyboard and mouse were cheap and did not work as advertised. I then found a ReDragon wireless keyboard/mouse combo and quickly decided to buy it.This combo is solid and well built and works quite well. The one and only drawback is that the mouse requires 2 AA batteries. The keyboard charges with a USB cable. I was hoping that the mouse would also charge with a USB cable. But all in all, I'd recommend this set to anyone looking at it.
title: Love ReDragon keyboard and mouse
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 29, 2023

text: ...it works. The mouse has nice weight to it with two AA batteries inside. (batteries not included) The mouse is excellent. 5 DPI settings. ECO mode. Just the right button touch. Easy scrolling wheel. I have large hands, all the buttons are in just the right place.I like the keyboard but I wish it were brighter. 8 colors. 5 brightness levels. Media player controls. Other convenient hotkeys.This a decent wireless m/k combo with a reasonable price point. Recommended.
title: Not the best, but...
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on February 1, 2023

text: I have this for a few months and while the RGB works well I've noticed some slight slipping in the keyboard and mouse after 4 months of use. This combo is my daily driver for my PC and I use my PC both for gaming and business. If you do a lot of gaming spend the extra money and get a TRUE mechanical keyboard and mouse. If you just using it for standard 9-5 type of work this will suit your needs no problem.
title: Good but slight slipping
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 12, 2022

text: I absolutely love this keyboard and mouse set. Iâ€™ve used Redragon previously with a wired set and now this wireless set.I work from home and the keyboard gives me a 5 day work week worth of charge with 10+ hours (I typically donâ€™t take a lunch away from my computer) going at it in on an average day. I like that itâ€™s mechanical without a large raise of keys.
title: Love this keyboard
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on October 3, 2022

text: The light for the keyboard shuts off after 55 seconds of inactivity meaning after the last key is hit. Not a big deal if using during the day or where there is light. Once it's dark it becomes an issue. Most games do not require you to use the keyboard constantly. For example an rpg where you use the mouse to go through the inventory or other instances where you need to only use the mouse. You have to hit a key to light it back up which can be problematic if you hit the wrong key and ruin what you are trying to accomplish in the game. Also th mouse doesn't slide smoothly. It's very difficult to get an accurate shot when you need to move the cross hair just a tiny bit and can't. Also in order to wake up the mouse you have to click the button which is usually the attack or shoot buttons. Not good for gaming. Most I've used all you have to do is move the mouse not accidentally shoot or hit something becauseyou have to click the mouse buttons to wake it up. I could go on and on. It's not a terrible keyboard and mouse but it's definitely not a gaming setup. I've used many set-ups and this is one that I would never buy again.
title: Not a good gaming setup
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 22, 2022

text: It's A Great Gaming Keyboard And Mouse The LEDs On It Aren't The Brightest I Could Be Wrong. Comes With It's USB C Charges Nicely. Mouse Has Settings For Sensitivity Which Is Nice And Such. Overall Not A Bad Gaming Keyboard If You're On A Budget!

text: I am re-rating this keyboard as two stars after having owned it for 6 months. It's problems have been ongoing problems. While the feel of the keyboard is very nice considering that it's a membrane keyboard, it drops keystrokes frequently.As in, whole words disappear. I can type something then look back and see that it has missed parts of words, individual characters, and whole words or parts of sentences as I type.Needless to say, this makes it a whole lot harder to do ANYTHING with this keyboard. Gaming, emails, you name it.The mouse is good, though bulky. It's a gaming mouse, it's supposed to be the size of a small tennis shoe, right? No complaints about the mouse's operation.But the dropped characters on the keyboard are driving me batty. So I need to get another.
title: Drops Lots of Keystrokes
